LTDLWOCR.ot:
r ` II LEO BllRNETT U.S.A. January 1, 1990 Donrey Outdoor Adv. Co. P.O. Box 18636 Oklahoma Citv, OR 73118 This letter, when signed by Donrey Outdoor Adv. Co. ("Company") and Leo Burnett Company, Inc. ("Agency") as agency for its clients ("Advertisers") shall constitute an agreement that all dealings between them regarding Outdoor Advertising shall be governed by the terms and conditions set forth in this letter agreement. For each advertising display ordered by Agency from Company, Agency and Company shall enter into separate agreements ("Individual Contracts"). Any Individual Contract for services to be performed by Company on behalf of Agency and its client(s) shall be governed by the terms specifically set forth therein and by the terms and conditions specifically set forth herein. In the event of a conflict between terms in an Individual Contract and the terms and conditions contained herein, the terms of the Individual Contract shall prevail. In addition, any instructions contained in painting or posting instructions shall prevail over the terms and conditions contained herein. 1.0 RATES: 1.1 All rates quoted in each Individual Contract are subject to an Agency commission of 16-2/3% of those rates, unless otherwise indicated in an Individual Contract. 1.2 All rates and adjustments shall be computed on a basis of thirty (30) days to a month. 1.3 Company represents that all its rates are published (except in the cases of permanent bulletins) and that the rates specified in each Individual Contract (including discounts under any plan of continuity, frequency or quantity) are the lowest rates at which any party may contract for like services at the time of that contract. 1.4 For the purpose of computing the applicable discount for each Advertiser, the service ordered under any Individual Contract, for the same market(s) and the same Advertiser, shall be combined with the service ordered under any other Individual Contract for any other products or services of Advertiser and its affiliates. Affiliates include, but are not limited to, Advertiser's subsidiaries, parent company and subsidiaries of the parent company. 2085614390 35 WEST WACRER DRIVE. CHICAGO, ILLINOIS 60601 1312) 220-5959 TELEX-25409B pgNbr=1 . -2- 1 2.0 INDEPENDENT CONTRACTOR; COMPLIANCE WITH APPLICABLE LAWS: 2.1 The Company's relationship to the Agency is that of an all independent contractor and Company will do any and things necessary to comply with laws and regulations pertaining to its independent business. 3.0 CANCELLATION OF INDIVIDUAL CONTRACTS: 3.1 Except in the case of permanent or rotary bulletins, any Individual Contract may be cancelled by Agency by giving written notice thereof to the Company no later than sixty (60) days, including Sunday and holidays, in advance of the scheduled posting date under an Individual Contract. In the case of permanent or rotary bulletins, cancellation shall be governed by the terms set forth in Individual Contracts. Cancellation of any Individual Contract shall not affect the application of these terms and conditions to any other Individual Contract between Company and Agency. 3.2 In the case of permanent or rotary bulletins, upon cancellation or non-renewal, the final month's payment shall not be due and owing to Company until Agency has received an affidavit from the Company confirming that any Display posted on behalf of Agency has been covered over or removed. 3.3 In the event of cancellation by Agency, Agency shall pay Company a short rate charge equal to the difference between the rate earned under the contract and the rate applicable to the service used, determined by reference to the rate card on which the contract rate is based, where applicable. 3.4 In the event that the Company delays in or fails to perform under an Individual Contract as the result of force majeure, labor dispute, legislation, court order or decision, regulation, administrative decision or rulemaking, federal, state, or local governmental action or order, any other law, or other cause beyond Company's reasonable control, including, but not limited to, the length of approach diversion, redirection of traffic, or obstruction of line of sight, such delay, failure, or cause shall not constitute breach of contract. However, in case of those events, Agency shall be notified immediately of such delay, failure, or cause in the manner set forth in Paragraph 7.2 and shall be entitled, at its election, to (1) cash, and/or (2) an extension of service, and/or (3) advertising service on new substituted location approved by Agency to be executed and maintained under the terms and 2085614391 pgNbr=2 I conditions hereof, and/or (4) credit, all on a pro rata basis. Notwithstanding the foregoing, in the event of a failure to provide illumination as required under Paragraph 6.0 herein, Agency shall be compensated by a cash credit equal to 25% of the monthly cost of the display. 3.5 Notwithstanding the foregoing, should any delay, failure or cause described in Paragraph 3.4 above, continue for a period of sixty (60) days or longer, in addition to credit as provided for in that Paragraph, Agency shall have the right to terminate the contract forthwith. 3.6 In the event there is any federal, state or local government law, ordinance or ruling that is enacted during any Individual Contract between Agency and Company, which makes advertising of any product or service specified in any Individual Contract between Company and Agency unlawful or which requires a modification to the advertising copy which, in the opinion of the Agency, reduces the value thereof to the Advertiser, Agency then reserves the right to terminate any Individual Contract so affected, without penalty and with no further payment, as of the date such law, ordinance, or ruling becomes effective. 3.7 It is further understood and agreed that Agency may cancel any Individual Contract without penalty at any time without notice by Agency in the event of adverse publicity of any nature resulting frc:n the presence of any Display placed pursuant to this Agreement. 3.8 In the event Agency cancels any Individual Contract(s), Agency's obligations shall cease, except that Agency shall make payment for unamortized costs of embellishments, if any. 4.0 CIGARETTE ADVERTISING: Outdoor Displays used to display cigarette advertising must be located a minimum of five hundred (500) feet away from the building, playground, or property adjacent to the following establishments: a. educational institutions (schools); b. churches; c. hospitals; N d. public playgrounds; or O Co e. cemeteries. Cn IM _a ~ w co N pgNbr=3 - 4 - ~ outdoor Bulletin Displays displaying cigarette advertising that are located more than five hundred (500) feet, in either direction, from the above-referenced establishments may not be facing the property or the buildings of said establishments. If there is any question as to whether a Display is within five hundred (500) feet of any of the above-referenced establishments, Company shall get approval of the Display from Agency's Field Representative. 5.0 RENEWAL: 5.1 At any time during the term of any Individual Contract, Agency has the first right to renew any such contract with the company, terms and conditions to be negotiated. 5.2 If Agency and Company do not reach an agreement on the rates proposed to renew the terms of any Individual Contract within sixty (60) days prior to the end of the term, then Company shall be free to negotiate with another Advertiser for the Outdoor Bulletin Display. The Company, however, cannot contract with another advertiser at rates lower than these offered to Advertiser for use of that Outdoor Bulletin Display without first offering the lower rates to Advertiser. 6.0 Ii.IdRIINATION: 6.1 All illuminated Displays shall be illuminated by up- to-date outdoor lighting, and shall be equipped properly with a sufficient number of reflectors and lamps of adequate size to evenly illuminate the entire Display. In the case of permanent and/or rotary bulletins, all new illuminated Displays shall be illuminated by Holophane Sign-Vue II fixtures equipped with 400 watt Sylvania Metralarc Lamps (clear); the equivalent may be used on existing illuminated Displays. All posted bulletins shall be illuminated by the aforementioned Sign-Vue II fixtures or fluorescent lights, unless variation is similarly approved by Agency. Notwithstanding the foregoing, other illumination may be used if (1) Agency is notified of the proposed variation in writing upon receipt of any Individual Contract from Agency by Company, and (2) Agency approves such variation, in writing. 6.2 Illuminated Displays shall be illuminated each night from one half hour prior to sunset to midnight. 6.3 Failure to conform performance to the terms set forth in this Paragraph 6.0 shall constitute failure to provide illumination. 2085614393 pgNbr=4 7.0 NOTICE: 7.1 All notices hereunder 4all be in writing, unless otherwise provided herein, shall be given only by prepaid telegram or mail to the addresses set forth below, and shall be dee',:ed given on the date of dispatch. 7.2 All notice(s) to Agency shall be sent to: LEO BURNETT COMPANY, IN?%. 35 West Wacker Chicago, Illinois 60601 Attn: Out-Of-Home Media Director referencing the particular Advertiser involved. All invoices shall be sent to the attention of Agency's Accounting Department, Section B. All notice(s) to Company shall be sent to the address set forth at the end of this Agreement. Each party shall notify the other of any changes in address. 8.0 TERMS OF PAYMENT: 8.1 Company will, within five (5) working days after completion of: a. initial copy, and each month thereafter (if
b. Outdoor Bulletin Display) or; posting for each date ordered (if poster display)
c. or; Displays for each date ordered (for other out of home media not specified in this Agreement) bill Agency at the address set forth in Paragraph 7.2 of this Agreement. Agency shall pay Company, at the address set forth at the foot of this Agreement or the address set forth in any Individual Contract, within 30 days after date of billing. 8.2 Company agrees to hold Agency solely liable for payment to the sums due under any Individual Contract(s). 8.3 Additionally, billing procedures shall follow the instructions set forth in the following documents, and any amendments to those documents, as applicable to each category: 2085614394 pgNbr=5 r - 6 - a. "Important Notice to All Outdoor Plants Regarding Billing Procedures for All Poster Contracts," b. "Important Notice to All Plants Regarding Billing Procedures for All Painted Bulletin Contracts," c. "Important Notice to All Plants Regarding Billing Procedures for all Miscellaneous and Transit Contracts." Copies of these documents are attached hereto and thereby incorporated into all contracts between Company and Agency, as applicable to each category. 9.0 INSURANCE: 9.1 At any time it provides services to Agency, Company agrees to maintain in full force and effect public liability insurance in the amounts of at least $500,000 for personal injury and $500,000 for property damage relating to the structures on which the Displays and/or posters will be exhibited, and Company agrees to provide Agency with a Certificate of Insurance evidencing such coverage. 10.0 WARRANTY AND INDEMNIFICATION: 10.1 To Company 10.11 Agency agrees to hold Company harmless against all liability arising out of the content of advertising materials furnished by Agency. 10.2 To Agency 10.21 Company warrants that it will construct and/or maintain all of the structures related to any Individual Contract in a safe and lawful manner and obtain all necessary leases, licenses and permits pertaining thereto, and Company agrees to hold Agency and Advertisers harmless from any and all claims (including reasonable attorney's fees) relating to the structures and their installation, maintenance, removal and any and all aspects of their operation, including but not limited to, all such liability arising out of Company's failure to remove posters within thirty (30) working days after the expiration of any Individual Contract, provided such failure is not due to force majeure. J 2085614395 pgNbr=6 - 7 - 11.0 ASSIGNMENT: 11.1 Neither party may assign this Agreement or any rights or obligations arising from this Agreement without the prior express written consent of the otherl provided, however, that nothing in this Agreement shall impair the right of any Advertiser to assign this Agreement, any Individual Contract, or its beneficial interest therein. In the event assignment does occur, such assignment shall not relieve the assigning party from its liability or obligations hereunder, and this Agreement as well as Individual Contracts shall also be binding on the successors and assigns of the assigning party. 11.2 Company agrees not to sell, lease, or otherwise convey any interest in an Outdoor Bulletin Display that is the subject of this Agreement or any Individual Contract to a third party except subject to the terms of this Agreement and any Individual Contract; Company shall take all necessary steps to ensure that the obligations of this Agreement and any Individual Contract run with any Outdoor Bulletin Display or other property to which they are subject. 12.0 COMPETITIVE ADVERTISING: 12.1 There will be no competitive products or services displayed by Company in the same facing for a minimum of: a. 300 feet preceding and/or following a poster panel; b. 1,000 feet preceding and/or following a bulletin. 13.0 ALTERATION OF MATERIAI6: 13.1 Company shall not make any alteration in advertising materials without written consent of Agency. 13.2 Unused material, including posters, may be disposed of by the Company upon completion of the schedule called for in any Individual Contract, or if no schedule is specified, fifteen (15) days after the last day of display schedule as defined in Agency's posting instructions, unless written instructions to do otherwise are received by Company. 13.3 Company shall not scrape Boards/Displays over the weekend. Scraping may only be done Monday through Thursday and Board/Display may not be out of service for more than twenty-four (24) hours. 2085614396 pgNbr=7 S - 8 - 13.4 Any changes not approved by Agency under Paragraphs 17.41 or 18.41 and any failure to give Agency notice required under those Paragraphs are subject to automatic credit to Agency for the displaced poster or advertising material. 14.0 TAXES: Company shall pay all taxes, except sales and use taxes, which may be applicable to the ownership or control of Display(s) or the display of materials thereon. 15.0 REJECTION OF MATERIALS: Company and any third party which controls the poster locations shall have the right to reject any advertising material submitted by Agency. In the event of such rejection, Agency shall have no obligation to pay for the service for which the rejected material was submitted and shall have the right to fully or partially terminate the Individual Contract dealing with rejected material. 16.0 OUTDOOR BULLETIN DISPLAYS IN ADDITION to the foregoing, the following terms and conditions shall govern all contracts for Outdoor Bulletin Displays: 16.1 Copy Changes 16.11 The following copy change options are available to Agency: (a) If any bulletin is to be completely painted, there will be three (3) complete paintings each year, including the initial; or (b) If any bulletin is to be partially posted, there will be six (6) postings of posted portion and three (3) paintings of painted portion each year, including the initial; or (c) If any bulletin is to be completely posted, there will be six (6) postings each year, including the initial. 16.12 Agency, as provided below, will deliver Acceptable Artwork to the Company in sufficient quantity for proper execution of display(s), all as provided herein below and in Individual Contracts. 2085614397 pgNbr=8 7 l - 9 - 16.13 In the case of a new contract, Agency will deliver Acceptable Artwork to the Company within thirty (30) days of receipt of Company's acceptance of the new contract. For subsequent copy changes, Agency will furnish Acceptable Artwork and instructions sixty (60) days prior to desired copy change date if this is a painted display, or forty five (45) days prior for a fully or partially posted display. 16.14 If, for any reason, Company cannot complete any copy change on the date specified, Company will notify Agency immediately. 16.15 "Acceptable Artwork" shall be defined as a scaled or properly proportioned mechanical, original illustration, dye transfer or other color reproduction of comparable quality. Color transparencies shall not be deemed to be Acceptable Artwork. 16.16 All copy changes agreed to as indicated on an Individual Contract may be carried over from one year to the next during the life of that Individual Contract. However, there will be no credits issued to Agency by Company for copy changes not used. 16.17 Any copy changes requiring a change in cut-outs must take place simultaneously. Both cut out and copy must be transferred at the same time in order to minimize down time. Any copy and/or cut out changes must be completed within a twenty-four (24) hour period and prior to the weekend. 16.2 OBZ.IGATIONS OF COMPANY: 16.21 All designs are to be faithfully reproduced, and all displays are to be maintained in accordance with standards of the industry, in the sole opinion of Agency. 16.22 Within five (5) days of completion of copy changes, Company will send completion notices to Agency, giving date of completion. 16.23 Upon completion of copy changes, Company will submit to Agency the following photo requirements on the date specified in painting instructions: 1 - 35mm color slide (close-up) 2 - 3 1/2" x 5" color prints (close-up) 16.24 Failure to supply the materials set forth in Paragraphs 16.22 and 16.23 in a timely fashion may result in Agency withholding payment of your invoice. 2085614398 pgNbr=9 C 16.25 company will be responsible for and agrees to maintain special treatment, if used, in a satisfactory condition through any Individual Contract term and will indemnify the Agency against loss or damage including, but not limited to, acts of God. 17.0 POSTER DISPLAYS: IN ADDITION to the foregoing general terms and conditions set forth in Paragraphs 1 - 15, the following terms and conditions shall govern all contracts for Poster Displays: 17.1 Location List 17.11 Company shall submit a location list in duplicate to Agency along with its invoice(s). The list shall conform to the requirements set forth in the document entitled "Important Notice to All Outdoor Plants Regarding Billing Procedures for all Poster contracts." Failure to submit such location list may, at sole option of Agency, result in Agency withholding payment of your invoice. 17.2 Delivery of Posters By Agency 17.21 Agency will deliver posters in quantity sufficient to meet the needs under any Individual Contract(s) (plus 10% for renewal purposes) at places designated by Company, shipping charges prepaid, at least fifteen (15) calendar days prior to the scheduled posting date(s). 17.3 Posting Obligations of Company 17.31 Except as hereinafter provided, the posters furnished by the Agency shall be posted by Company in the markets and on the dates scheduled in any Individual Contract. 17.32 Posters will be freshly blanked at the time of each posting on panels which are maintained in accordance with standards of the industry, and will be distributed on locations approved by Agency representative. 17.33 Posters and panels will be kept in good condition throughout the term of any Individual Contract. Posters will be promptly reposted, provided sufficient additional posters are supplied by Agency. Company will notify Agency immediately if posters are needed for reposting. 2085614399 pgNbr=10 Y 17.34 If posters are timely delivered, Company shall complete posting no sooner than five (5) working days before and no later than five (5) working days after the scheduled posting date. Advertisers shall have the benefit of a full thirty (30) days display from the average date of posting. Company will immediately notify Agency by telephone and in writing if posters are not received on time. 17.35 If posters are timely delivered but cannot be posted in accordance with Paragraph 17.31, Agency will be informed immediately and any available substitute dates and locations will be submitted for Agency's approval. Such inability to post shall be governed by the terms of Paragraphs 3.4 and 3.5 herein. 17.4 Poster Placement 17.41 Company retains exclusive control and supervision over the posting, maintenance and removal of the posters and over the location on which they are displayed. Any proposed change made in location of posters, for any reason, must be reported to Agency in writing ten (10) days prior to such change, along with a statement of reason for the change, a statement of comparable location, and information regarding daily effective circulation and type of panel. All proposed changes must be approved by Agency. 18.0 MISCELS-ANEOUS: IN ADDITION to the foregoing general terms and conditions set forth in Paragraphs 1- 15, the following terms and conditions shall govern all contracts for Out-Of-Home Media not specifically addressed elsewhere in this Agreement: 18_1 Advertising Service 18.11 Company shall install the advertising display materials furnished by Agency on the locations and dates scheduled on the face of Individual Contracts. Company agrees to maintain the Displays in good condition and promptly replace soiled or defaced Displays with extra material furnished for that purpose. Advertisers should have full display thirty (30) days from average date of installation. 18.2 Installation 18.21 Installation should be completed no sooner than five (5) working days before and no later than five (5) working days following scheduled carding or posting dates. 208561 4400 pgNbr=11 ~ 18.3 Advertising Display Materials ' 18.31 Agency will provide advertising display materials at places designated by Company (shipping charges prepaid) at least fifteen (15) calendar days prior to display date. Company will notify Agency immediately if materials are not redeived by that time. 18.32 Agency is entitled to a>~hange of display material once every thirty (30) days without charge, on scheduled dates. 18.4 Placement ! 18.41 company retains exclusive control and supervision over placement, maintenance and removal of the advertising materials and over the locations on which they are displayed. Any proposed change made in location of advertising materials for any reason, must be reported in writing to Agency ten (10) days prior to such change, along with a statement of reason for the change, a statement of comparable location, and information regarding daily effective circulation. All proposed changes are subject to Agency approval. Failure of either party to enforce any of the provisions hereof shall not be construed as a general relinquishment or waiver of that or any other provision. If Company agrees to the foregoing, please execute both copies of this Agreement and return one original copy to Agency, retaining the other copy for your files. Very truly yours, ACCEPTED AND AGREED TO: LEO BURNETT COMPANY, INC.
